content.description: Start down low on slopers on the right most side of the wall.  Move up and right thought the steep bulge via crimps and slopers.  Be careful of the looming tree behind your head!!  Once up on the low angle slab at the top of the line traverse off left to safety.  Great hard line!!
content.location: The Tortuga "Widower Wall" is located just behind (North) of the Gilligan's Islands formation.  The "Widower Wall" is just left (West) and slightly down hill a bit of the main "South Wall" of the "Tortuga Area."

content.description:
Start the same as for "

They All Fall Down

" on a sidepull jug feature in the back of the cave. Instead of traversing right, work up to a right-hand crimp, and move straight up into the crack of the roof, making some strenuous moves to gain jugs and a mellow topout.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter are ideal.
content.location:
This is on the right side of the cave, sharing the start with "

They All Fall Down

".

content.description:
Start down low in the back of the cave like feature on good jugs.  Work out the roof on good holds to a tuff match sloper move at the lip.  Continue to climb stright up past more bad slopers to the finsih.  Exit the same as for the "

Widower

."

(One of the major holds currently has a bird's nest in it... please do not disturb the nest!!)
content.location: The Tortuga "Widower Wall" is located just behind (North) of the Gilligan's Islands formation.  The "Widower Wall" is just left (West) and slightly down hill a bit of the main "South Wall" of the "Tortuga Area."

content.description: Sit start low, right with right hand on an undercling pinch and your left hand on big pinch.  Make a big move up left to a jug.  Match.  Use the two crimps along roof and sidepull in corner to gain pretty good jug in crack.  Climb the crack up, and top out.  Downclimb to the right.
content.location: It is on Widower Wall.  Go to the Tortuga area north of Gilligan's Island past The Black Pearl, next set of problems on the right hand side past the "Early Manhood Block."

content.description:
Start lower than "

Slap 'em Down

" on two small ledges for hands.  Climb into "

Slap 'em Down

."  Keep your feet off the walls to the right.  The moves between are fun.  Commit to the top, and all you need is a pad.
content.protection: Pad.  Just make sure to commit to the top.
content.location: This is back in Tortuga at the Widower Wall.

content.description:
SDS on opposing side pulls on the feature packed face right of "

Widower

". There are two variations of this problem. Follow the bomber features up and to the left toward the crack for "Muskets". This is the V3 variation. Do the same start start for the V4 variation, "Cannons", except at the shelf you make a move right toward the big horn feature and commit to the 5.9 slab to top out...very lofty, I wouldn't try falling from here. Top out and walk off right or left. If you keep going up and to the right, you will end up on top of "Trophy Pedestal".
content.protection: A pad is nice for the SDS. Other than that, you are more or less committing to a solo, either variation tops out high.
content.location:
It is right of "

Widower

" on the on the Widower Wall.
